I agree scooter, too many "IF's" and "I think's" that are not worth the risk!

content: quote: Originally posted by Navy_Grunt: ***{http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/O/OBAMA_TALIBAN?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT}*** "President Barack Obama says he hopes U.S. troops can identify moderate elements of the Taliban and move them toward reconciliation" Sleep well everyone! General David Petraeus said of Afghanistan recently: “You don’t kill or capture your way out of an industrial-strength insurgency.” So what is the answer, if not to talk to those who will fight for generations against the America forces? The Russians had 100,000 plus troops in Afghanistan and used anti-insurgent tactics that American commanders would refuse to carry out, in the name of “do what has to be done.” They left in defeat. After seven years of war, President Bush had no plan for victory in Afghanistan. So what should be President Obama’s plan that does not include talking to the enemy?

content: quote: Originally posted by xerello: quote: Originally posted by Navy_Grunt: ***{http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/O/OBAMA_TALIBAN?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT}*** "President Barack Obama says he hopes U.S. troops can identify moderate elements of the Taliban and move them toward reconciliation" Sleep well everyone! General David Petraeus said of Afghanistan recently: “You don’t kill or capture your way out of an industrial-strength insurgency.” So what is the answer, if not to talk to those who will fight for generations against the America forces? The Russians had 100,000 plus troops in Afghanistan and used anti-insurgent tactics that American commanders would refuse to carry out, in the name of “do what has to be done.” They left in defeat. After seven years of war, President Bush had no plan for victory in Afghanistan. So what should be President Obama’s plan that does not include talking to the enemy? I have problems with this approach. There is a difference in saying that we will be happy to amnesty those who wish to rejoin the Afghan community, and defacto recognising the Taliban. As another poster asks, "What is a moderate Taliban?" Sure, spread the word, that if you surrender, we wont even treat you as a prisoner. All will be forgiven. Do this on a low key, don't include the leadership, etc, etc. Taliban ideology is a version of Islam that never existed. They are defacto quite comparable to the most extreme political ideology. There is absolutely nothing that they cannot justify, and have justified. I've consistantly posted that to combat the Taliban we have to place our primary support to the secular forces of Afghanistan - i.e. those who have a greater incentive to terminate the Taliban than we do. We simply have picked and we simply support the wrong people. Dope dealers, and Fundamentalist light. The first so corrupt, that they are only interested in making money, the other, will betray us in a flash. Dave

content: quote: The Russians had 100,000 plus troops in Afghanistan and used anti-insurgent tactics that American commanders would refuse to carry out, in the name of “do what has to be done.” They left in defeat. Actually, Russia was doing quite well in A-stan until Reagan had the CIA fund, train and arm the Mujahadeen in the very same tactics now used against US and NATO troops now by the sons of these radicals in a very clear example of what goes around, comes around. And Dave, my source at the State department says these Palestinians are coming to America a couple hundred per week and getting housing and food stamps but no one is telling them how to act in the host country. The same thing happened with Somalis who came to the US now have sons return to fight against US interests and have made quite an enterprise in kidnapping and piracy with their knowledge learned in the US. Its quite useful for them to be able to make ransom demands in English.

Do this on a low key, don't include the leadership, etc, etc. Taliban ideology is a version of Islam that never existed. They are defacto quite comparable to the most extreme political ideology. There is absolutely nothing that they cannot justify, and have justified. I've consistantly posted that to combat the Taliban we have to place our primary support to the secular forces of Afghanistan - i.e. those who have a greater incentive to terminate the Taliban than we do. We simply have picked and we simply support the wrong people. Dope dealers, and Fundamentalist light. The first so corrupt, that they are only interested in making money, the other, will betray us in a flash. Dave
title: Obama: US should reach out to Taliban moderates

content: quote: Originally posted by Navy_Grunt: ***{http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/O/OBAMA_TALIBAN?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT}*** "President Barack Obama says he hopes U.S. troops can identify moderate elements of the Taliban and move them toward reconciliation" Sleep well everyone! The moderate elements of the Taliban are quite easily identified in Afghanistan. They are the ones who won't cut your throat while you are sleeping if given the chance. Hope President Obama has some of his own people to send to put them to the test. As much as he'd like to send Republicans...and/or Rush.

content: quote: The Russians had 100,000 plus troops in Afghanistan and used anti-insurgent tactics that American commanders would refuse to carry out, in the name of “do what has to be done.” They left in defeat. And Dave, my source at the State department says these Palestinians are coming to America a couple hundred per week and getting housing and food stamps but no one is telling them how to act in the host country. The same thing happened with Somalis who came to the US now have sons return to fight against US interests and have made quite an enterprise in kidnapping and piracy with their knowledge learned in the US. Its quite useful for them to be able to make ransom demands in English.
